result.execSummary:
The defendant Joseph T. Beale was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Burglarious Tools, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.12.

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Provide DNA sample.  Undergo any counseling/treatment per agent.  Absolute Sobriety.  ALL COURT ORDERED OBLIGATIONS TO BE PAID THROUGH CLERK OF COURTS WITHIN 60 DAYS OR SET UP PAYMENT ARRANGEMENTS.
Case to be expunged if law abiding, fine/restitution paid in full and/or probation is successfully completed, under 973.015.

If extended supervision revoked or discharges with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

Defendant Joseph T. Beale in court with attorney Puck Tsai.  Rick C Spoentgen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  No Contest Plea entered, advised of constitutional rights, plea accepted by Court. JB's mother makes statement. Victim makes statement.   Court. finds Defendant guilty.  Court withholds sentence.

Count 1: Dismissed but read in

Count 2:
60 months Probation
Provide DNA surcharge/sample
Undergo any counseling per agent
Absolute Sobriety
Case to be expunged if law abiding, fine paid in full and/or probation is successfully completed, under 973.015.
$ Restitution with 15% Surcharge To:  (PAID THRU CLERK OF COURTS) PER STIPULATION
$528.00 Costs fees (PAID THRU CLERK OF COURTS)

Attorney Puck Tsai in court.  Sue Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Atty. Tsai states DE on the intake basis for drug court.  Just found out yesterday that didn't happen. Team ran out of time to discuss.  State requests warrant, todays date was set for DE to appear.  Based on non-appearance, court authorized warrant but stay 2 weeks.  Return date scheduled for March 15, 2017 at 01:00 pm.
Return date on February 21, 2017 at 01:00 pm.

Attorney Puck Tsai in court.  Sue Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Tsai gives status.  Defendant not required to appear today.  Matters are resolved, however assessments need to be finished.  Request short reset/status in 45 days.  State request less time and return for mandatory appearance.  Bond continues.  Return date scheduled for February 21, 2017 at 01:00 pm.

Defendant Joseph T. Beale in court with attorney Puck Tsai.  Sue Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Atty Tsai states status.  Believes matter will all be resolved.  DE is being referred to drug court.  Requests any JT's be taken off the calendar.  Court will not do that yet.  State has no knowledge of DE's status as to drug court but there has been no notice provided for JT as of yet.  State also believed matters would be resolved.  State suggests all matters be set for status conference early one morning on all three matters about 2 weeks down the road so Atty Tsai can inform the Court as to the drug court status.  Court resets.  JT's are cancelled.  Bonds continued in all matters.  Telephone conference scheduled for July 6, 2016 at 08:30 am.
